msContents.summary: List of individuals paying the syntaximon.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso contains cols. VI (right half) and VII of SB XVI, 12632

condition.ab: The papyrus is fairly well preserved, but there are numerous lacunae. The surface is broken in places, and the tops of the opening columns have been lost. This sheet contains cols. IX-XIII (left half). One kollesis visible, approximately 7.5 cm from the left edge of papyrus.

handDesc.p: The papyrus is written in a good cursive hand which becomes increasingly smaller toward the end of the document, but which seems to be that of the same scribe throughout. The list has been carefully checked, each entry having at the beginning a short, thick, diagonal stroke obviously added later by a different pen. In addition, some of the entries, especially in col. IX, have a second check placed over the numeral at the end of the line. In view of this fact and the circumstance that three entries have been bracketed (see note to l. 233), we conclude that for some reason the account was doubly audited for this day (the 12th).

origin.origPlace: Philadelphia, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Horos, son of the older Atilon
Pam..eus, son of M[.]llko() the younger
Ammonis, son of the older Ko()
Herakles, son of Mysthes the older, son of Phanos
Herakles, son of Proganos (?), son of Laro()

provenance.p: Philadelphia, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: " Horos, son of the older Atilon, 4 dr. with the addition,;Horos, likewise, the younger, 4 dr. with the addition,;Pam..eus, son of M[.]llko() the younger 4 dr. with the addition,;Petermouthis, son of Psenobastis, 8 dr. with the addition,;216,;another 26th, Harmiysis, son of Amounis, 28 dr. with the addition,;Ptolemais, son of Chethos, 4 dr. with the addition,;Psa...tisneus, son of Praxias, 24 dr.,;Panetbys, son of Petemounis, 28 dr.,;Ammonis, son of the older Ko(), 12 dr.,;Herakles, son of Mysthes the older, son of Phanos, 12 dr. with the addition,;Mysthas, son of Herakles, 12 dr.,;Herakles, son of Proganos (?), son of Laro(), 8 dr.,;Theon, son of Hareotos, 4 dr. with the addition,;Hatres, son of Hareotos, 4 dr. with the addition,;Mysthas, son of Hareotos, 8 dr. with the addition,;Horion, likewise, 40 dr. with the addition,;. . . ., son of Apion, 12 dr.,;Apion, son of Apion, 8 dr.,;. . . .n, son of Hareotos, 8 dr.,;180,;1st of the Epagomenai, ;Isidoros, son of Peteuchos, 16 dr.,;[..]eteon, son of Ischyrion, 36 dr. with the addition,;Lysimachos, son of Sambas, 28 dr.,;[..]tes, likewise, 12 dr.,;. . tes, likewise, his son, 16 dr.,;Herakles,likewise, 20 dr.,;Pamsneus, son of Petosiris, 4 dr.,;Papesneus, son of Ermois, 44 dr.,;Hatres, son of Ischyrion, 4 dr.,;Petemounis, son of Ischyrion, 4 dr.,;. . . . ., son of Harentotos, 12 dr.,;. . . .tos, son of Satabous, 4 dr.,;Petosiris, son of Psenobastis, 8 dr. with the addition,;. . . .ous, likewise, 8 dr.,;P...phros, son of Papous, 8 dr.,;.....(), son of Papous, 12 dr.,;Apynchis, son of Marres, 32dr."
